オプション1: Star Man looked ahead and saw a cylindrical object approaching him.
(Oh no. That’s a monster too, isn’t it?)
Since the monsters usually remain completely still, they’re hard to spot. You only notice them once they start moving.
(This time it’s shaped like a cylinder...)
The monster was about the same size as the cubes, but cylindrical.
(Should I try fighting it...?)
Star Man readied his stone spear.

For the past week, Star Man had been living on the run from monsters.
Among them, he especially had to dodge projectiles thrown by disc-shaped enemies,
which had honed his reflexes to a sharp edge.
<Zaaa!>
The cylindrical monster charged like a bull.
Star Man jumped to the side to dodge. Dirt and leaves scattered around him.
The cylindrical monster turned toward him and slowly began to approach.

(I dodged it earlier because there was distance...
But if it charges from that close, I probably can’t avoid it.
If I get stepped on, I might die instantly...)
Like the other monsters, this cylindrical one also seemed to weigh several hundred kilos.
(I should run.)

Star Man ran off at a trot.
Even if he defeated a monster, he couldn’t eat it or get any materials from it.
So unless it was a frequently used or unavoidable path, he usually chose to flee.

After walking for a while, he came to an open area.
There stood a collapsed, old house—made of straw and mud walls, the kind you never see in modern times.
Inside the house, a human skeleton lay on the ground.

(There’s no way a skeleton just ends up in a house under normal circumstances...
This feels like it was something sinister...)

Hidden by grass, there was a faint path leading from the abandoned house into the forest.
Using a stick to push aside the overgrowth, Star Man followed it.
At the end, he found a small cemetery and a shrine.
(!! A person...!)
An old woman was sitting in the cemetery.
Star Man cautiously spoke to her.
(I hope she’s not another robot-like person...)
"Do you have a moment?"
"Ah... so it’s that time already..."
Ah...
The old woman let out a sigh.
"I’d like to ask you something."
A moment of silence passed between them.
"Alright."
(Thank goodness... someone I can actually talk to.)
"I was shipwrecked and ended up here."
"Nice to meet you..."
"Yes, likewise."
"Tell me about those monsters roaming everywhere. What are they?"
Bioweapons... Experimental creations from Zeefolk dumped here."
Zeefolk was a developing country west of this island.
"...I see…"

"They’re not that advanced. Just stuff like making plants move,
or implanting plant cells into animals.
It lets them survive without food or water."

On Planet Poweredge, genetic modification had become common, even at the household level.
Even in developing nations, creatures were engineered for all sorts of purposes.
"I’ve never heard anything about that until now."
"This is an island no one comes to. You made a pact with a demon, didn’t you?"
"Huh...? ...Yeah."
"That demon appears to those on the verge of death and offers them contracts."
"Those who come back to life gain power.

When conflict breaks out, the powerful defeat the powerless.
They can kill them."
"The powerless, fearing death, also make contracts and revive."
Star Man’s expression turned grim.

"Those who make a pact can use magic.
With training, their power becomes overwhelming—capable of killing many at once.
And when many are killed, many more sign contracts and revive."

"It spread like a chain reaction.
But all contracts come with a one-year death sentence.
That’s how everyone on this island perished."
"The monsters started being dumped here after that."
"I see... so that’s the story."

"One more thing—I'd like to escape within a year, for the sake of my friends.
Do you know any good way?"

"Can’t think of anything... If you could get off the island, that’d be ideal.
Your contract would be nullified too."
"Huh? The contract would be nullified?"
"Yeah. If you leave the island, the contract ends and you’re free."
"Really? How do you know that?"
"Huh? How did I know that...?"
(Can I really believe that...?)
"Anyway, thank you."
After that, Star Man gathered some food and returned to the ruins.
